abstract: Bank of America is mounting a campaign to rehire several of the more than three dozen senior Merrill Lynch investment bankers who quit after the firms merged, Bloomberg News reported.
snippet: Bank of America is mounting a campaign to rehire several of the more than three dozen senior Merrill Lynch investment bankers who quit after the firms merged, Bloomberg News reported.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America is mounting a campaign to rehire several of the more than three dozen senior Merrill Lynch investment bankers who quit after the firms merged, Bloomberg News reported, citing people familiar with the efforts.

headline.main: Bank of America Seeks to Lure Merrill Bankers, Report Says

abstract: Two top bankers at Bank of America Merrill Lynch, Steven Baronoff and Stefan Selig, recently talked to Investment Dealers’ Digest about business after the merger of the two firms.
snippet: Two top bankers at Bank of America Merrill Lynch, Steven Baronoff and Stefan Selig, recently talked to Investment Dealers’ Digest about business after the merger of the two firms.
lead_paragraph: Buying an investment bank is always a risky proposition, in part because there’s no guarantee that the bankers will stay put. Bank of America has faced this issue in its recent deal for Merrill Lynch, as it has seen many of its senior bankers head for the door.

headline.main: A Post-Merger Talk With Top BofA Bankers
